original_title: Sri Lanka tightens security thieves target key bridge
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Authorities have tightened security at a bridge over the river Kelani and an expressway to the main airport after the theft of equipment including cables valued at 275 million rupees, Sardha Weerakoon, Director at Sri Lanka’s Road Development Authority said.
Thieves have taken away equipment at Katunayake Expressway including 13 kilometers of copper cables valued at 250 million rupees.
From the New Kelani Bridge, robbers had taken away panel boards, down pipes, cables and CCTV cameras worth 25 million rupees, Weerakoon said.
Police are probing the robberies and have so far managed to recover about 4.5 million rupees of equipment.(Colombo/July17/2023)
